column4: how do i make apt-get remove ONLY REMOVE the packages it installed
aka, im trying to remove wine & it want's to remove the linux kernel.
how do i make apt-get remove ONLY REMOVE the packages it installed
aka, im trying to remove wine & it want's to remove the linux kernel.
it wants to remove linux headers
even though it didn't install them,.
I'd suggest doing apt-get update && apt-get upgrade   and then try removing wine again
well, it didnt install it and it wants to remove it
how can i make apt-get remove only remove the packages it installed.
it wants to remove wine-gecko linux-headers-2.6.28-11 ttf-liberation linux-headers-2.6.28-11-generic winbind libaudio2
I'd suggest doing apt-get update && apt-get upgrade   and then try removing wine again
it didn't install all of that stuff.
when i remove wine, ubuntu wants to remove   wine-gecko linux-headers-2.6.28-11 ttf-liberation linux-headers-2.6.28-11-generic winbind libaudio2
if not, then i'll proceed, but i know installing wine didn't install those linux headers.
